div.p:
Copy of original historical letter
From DrDavid Livingstone

Having nothing official to write about I
send this private note to say that I am
making preparations for starting in
November when the monsoon changes, &
when we hope a Man of War will be here.
I have got 8 Africans & some drilled men
- Indians - of the Marine Battalion who
have been accustomed to rough it in the
Persian Gulph & are said to be quite
trustworthy.

In addition to these I intend to take
buffaloes as beasts of burden, & I am
indulging in hope that they may
understand the poison of the Tsetse, &
if they do we shall confer a great boon on
East Africa. The brutes are as like our
wild African ones as two peas, except the
horns, & I am told the horns of the tame
ones are often straightened out artificially
I have seen several with the regular
curves of the wild ones.

The men of the Marine BatallionBattallion
being Indians know how to manage
them.

The Sultan of Zanzibar is coming here
I shall make what arrangements are
necessary when he comes, & then I
can land at Rovuma without
delay, & when we get to the coast, I
am acquainted with Revd Dr Wilson
whom you may remember at
Constantinople

Copied from the
Original letter by
C. G. Reeve
FebyFebruary 1938
